question: 壊す
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>break</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to break something</vocabulary>, because you're doing the breaking. You know this because someone is trying to <reading>sue</reading> (<ja>す</ja>) you for the things you broke of theirs.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The thing you broke? A beautiful ceramic <reading>koa</reading>la (<ja>こわ</ja>). Watch it shatter to the ground, because you threw it there. What a jerk you are.
